titles: Loves fierce desire, and hopes of recovery. Or, A true and brief description of two resolved lovers; whose excellent wits, sutable minds, and faithful hearts one to another, shall heedfully be spoken of in this following new made paper of verses. To a delightful new tune, or, Fair angel of England.
author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?
publisher: Printed for F[rancis]. Coles, T[homas]. Vere, J[ohn]. Wright, J[ohn]. Clarke, W[illiam]. Thackeray, and T[homas]. Passinger.,
notes: Date, place of publication and publisher's names from Wing.
Includes: Celia her sweet reply to her faithful friend.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
keywords: Broadsides --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
Love poetry, English --  England --  Early works to 1800.
